page.title: 03WESTON RHYN, OSWESTRY
page.content: The village of{Weston Rhyn}is situated near to the Welsh border and is spread along the B5070 road. Its centre is a crossroads near{St. John's Church,}The Lodge public house and a general store. It has a primary school, post office, fish and chip shop and a small grocery business. There are two main areas of council housing estates. One is primarily bungalows built for pensioners. Villagers travel to{work}in Chirk, Wrexham and Oswestry as there is no industry close by. Various groups are organised in the village for all ages and include,{Womens Institute, Scouts, {Brownies, Old Friends Club and a {football team. A home for disadvantaged children, {The Quinta}has now been closed.The railway station on the Shrewsbury to Chester line is no longer used.
